poem:
**EU Morning News**

In Davos, the echo of plans unfolds,  
as Ursula maps a new lattice of ties,  
fractures realign, the ink redeems  
the rift where Trump's shadow lies.  
  
Through a window, the world holds its breath—  
a continent listens to its heartbeat,  
and pens loop, striving to weave  
what was splintered, into something whole.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ursula von der Leyen seeks closer economic ties across EU as new Trump era begins The president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, has called for a new era of EU integration to sustain growth in the face of a global economy “fracturing along new lines” as Donald Trump enters the White House. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos while the US president prepares to press ahead with his protectionist agenda,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
